title.rendered: National Championship 2020: Halftime Show, Live Stream and TV Coverage

content.rendered:
If you have been expecting to see the upcoming National Championship 2020, you cannot miss the opportunity to watch the entertaining Halftime show from the beginning to the end. Back then, college football playoff announced the musical talents lineup for the halftime show of the event. Now with such a list, you will be able to see if your favorite performers will be performing at the halftime show or not.

The great thing about the halftime show is that all of the artists are the names that you are familiar with. The officials have confirmed that the performers lines joining up in the Halftime show are Meghan Trainor, Tim McGraw, H.E.R., bAstille, Nas, Judah & the Lion, Trombone Shorty & Orleans Avenue, as well as MAX Highlight Weekend of Free Concerts.

It is great to know as well that the multi-platinum national recording artists will make the event much more special at the AT&T Playoff Playlist Live! From January 11th to 12th. Meanwhile, the other performers will be staging at the Capital One Stage at Allstate Championship Tailgate Plaza on January 13. Those who are not seeing their favorite artists on these stages would need to check on the free concerts instead. Yes, there is another free concert which you and your friends can enjoy at the New Orleans’ Woldenberg Park.

The acts which we mentioned above involve various artists from different genres such as R&B, rock, rap, pop, country, as well as jazz. It is going to be an interesting event to follow with your friends and special ones. Let’s start with Trombone Shorty & Orleans Avenue. They will be taking the stage at AT&T Playoff Playlist Live! Meanwhile, Tim McGraw will be headlining the Capital One Stage at Allstate Championship Plaza. If you are the country music lover, you will surely want to see his actions at the Championship Plaza. Then Lauren Diagle will headline the national anthem right before the national championship game starts. The performances will be nicely wrapping the entire event with such hype festivity.

The official broadcaster of the upcoming event has been announced. If you stay, live, or travel in the US, don’t hesitate to tune into ESPN to watch the event. You can also live stream the event through official live streaming service provided by ESPN and get the access by using your credentials.

With tons of entertainment presented to you, there is no reason to miss the halftime show of the National Championship 2020.
